2.caption_en:
Slide titled "Checklist for viable ecosystem opportunities" that lists six ecosystem frictions/opportunities with brief explanations and real-world examples (e.g., online food delivery, Alibaba, ride‑hailing, Airbnb, John Deere, Intel). The slide is organized as two columns of checked items: three demand/supply/matching items on the left and three trust/coordination/co‑innovation items on the right.

{
  "title": "Checklist for viable ecosystem opportunities",
  "type": "slide/infographic",
  "language": "English",
  "layout": "two_column",
  "visual_cues": {
    "check_icons": true,
    "bold_headings": true
  },
  "items": [
    {
      "column": "left",
      "order": 1,
      "heading": "Fragmented Demand",
      "description": "Platforms aggregate demand from many small customers and make it accessible to suppliers in an economically viable way.",
      "example": "Online food delivery platforms provide restaurants access to a highly fragmented base of potential customers.",
      "checked": true
    },
    {
      "column": "left",
      "order": 2,
      "heading": "Fragmented Supply",
      "description": "Platforms aggregate offerings from many small-scale suppliers to facilitate search and transactions for buyers.",
      "example": "Alibaba provided large companies access to small and medium-size Chinese suppliers that were previously hard to find.",
      "checked": true
    },
    {
      "column": "left",
      "order": 3,
      "heading": "Matching Problem",
      "description": "Platforms enable real-time matching of both sides of a market and help ensure a deal is made.",
      "example": "Ride-hailing platforms identify the best-positioned driver for a given rider and facilitate the transaction.",
      "checked": true
    },
    {
      "column": "right",
      "order": 1,
      "heading": "Lack of Trust",
      "description": "Ecosystems can establish transactional trust when partners are unknown or vulnerable to fraud or misbehavior.",
      "example": "Airbnb vets guests and secures payments to create the trust needed for owners to invite strangers into their homes.",
      "checked": true
    },
    {
      "column": "right",
      "order": 2,
      "heading": "Lack of Supplier Coordination",
      "description": "Ecosystems enable coherent customer solutions requiring coordination among independent suppliers of products or services.",
      "example": "John Deere's smart farming platform coordinates seeds, fertilizers, equipment, agronomic and weather data to increase productivity.",
      "checked": true
    },
    {
      "column": "right",
      "order": 3,
      "heading": "Lack of Co-Innovation",
      "description": "Resolving some frictions requires aligned innovations from multiple domain companies to achieve full impact.",
      "example": "Intel orchestrated an ecosystem of PC component developers through the Intel Architecture Lab to remove performance bottlenecks.",
      "checked": true
    }
  ],
  "source": "Book \"Business Ecosystems (Inspiring the next game)\", 2022"
}

3.caption_en: Slide titled "Checklist for viable ecosystem opportunities" listing six key frictions and opportunities—Fragmented Demand, Fragmented Supply, Matching Problem, Lack of Trust, Lack of Supplier Coordination, and Lack of Co‑Innovation—with short explanations and examples (e.g., Alibaba, ride‑hailing, Airbnb, John Deere, Intel).
3.caption_ru: Slide titled "Checklist for viable ecosystem opportunities" listing six key frictions and opportunities—Fragmented Demand, Fragmented Supply, Matching Problem, Lack of Trust, Lack of Supplier Coordination, and Lack of Co‑Innovation—with short explanations and examples (e.g., Alibaba, ride‑hailing, Airbnb, John Deere, Intel).
